results.name: default/wordpress-7cdb8c4694-p296c

error.Text: Readiness probe failed: HTTP probe failed with statuscode: 500

results.details:
Error: The readiness probe failed because the application returned a 500 status code, indicating an internal server error.

Solution: 
1. Check application logs for errors.
2. Ensure all dependencies are running.
3. Verify configuration settings.
4. Restart the application.

results.name: default/mysql

error.Text: Service has not ready endpoints, pods: [Pod/mysql-7889fff6c4-4dmhr], expected 1

results.details:
Error: The service has no ready endpoints because the expected pod is not ready.

Solution: 
1. Check pod status with `kubectl get pods`.
2. Inspect pod logs using `kubectl logs Pod/mysql-7889fff6c4-4dmhr`.
3. Verify pod readiness probe configuration.
4. Ensure the pod is running and healthy.

results.name: default/wordpress

error.Text: Service has not ready endpoints, pods: [Pod/wordpress-7cdb8c4694-p296c], expected 1

results.details:
Error: The service doesn't have any ready endpoints because the expected pod is not ready.

Solution: 
1. Check pod status with `kubectl get pods`.
2. Describe pod for issues: `kubectl describe pod wordpress-7cdb8c4694-p296c`.
3. Look for readiness probe failures.
4. Fix any issues and redeploy if necessary.
